author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Foodgrains Merchants Association has welcomed the announcement of a new Madurai-Aruppukottai-Tuticorin rail line by Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu in the Railway Budget on Thursday.

In a statement issued here on Friday, S.P. Jeyapragasam, president, said the new line was a long-time demand of the residents of south Tamil Nadu. The association also welcomed the allocation of Rs 700 crore for the doubling of track in T.N, Rs 101 crore for gauge conversion in the Shencottah-Punalur section and Rs 320 crore for the double line project between Kanyakumari and Thiruvananthapuram. It appealed to the Railway Minister to allocate more funds for the completion of the Madurai-Bodinaickanur broad gauge line project, a long-pending demand, for which Rs 25 crore has been earmarked in the budget.
title: Foodgrains merchants hail new rail line
